Acolyte

Divine Doctrine
Rank 1
✚ You follow set of principles in your belief system or religious practice, referred to as your Divine Doctrine. Each Divine Doctrine consists of Virtues, Taboos, and Domains.
When you act against your Virtues or engage in a Taboo, reduce your Concordance by 1.
Select two items from the list below to be your Virtues and two items to be your Taboos:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Courage, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .
Select 2 Effect Skills from the list below to be your Domain:
Bellor, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Rime, Tempest, Vivus
Commitment to your Divine Doctrine lets you access Rites. If one your Rite's result set contains a 1, reduce your Concordance by 1.
If you attempt to use a Rite when you Concordance is below 0, add 1 Hazard die to the roll for each point your Concordance is below 0.

Mystic

Seek Mysteries
Rank 1
✚ You hold knowledge of the mysteries of the cosmos, bending secret powers to your will. You gain access to Arcana.
Intuit, Research, or use your Insight to unravel these mysteries further, gaining Hits in Arcana Ranks to invest in your Arcana.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint. If you use it during a Waypoint, it requires 4 Actions.
Strain Susceptibility
Rank 1
✚ Your pursuit of Arcana expose you to Strain.
When you roll one of your Affinity to invoke and Arcana, you gain Strain according to the result as soon as the Arcana effects resolve.
Strain accumulates over the course of your adventures, only reducing by 1d6 at the conclusion of a Waypoint.
You suffer the effects of Strain according to the Straing Effects Table table below. Strain Effects are cumulative:
Strain Effect
0-4 No effect
5-9 Fatigued 1
10-14 Confused
15-19 Fatigued 2
20-24 Vulnerable 3
25-29 Stunned 4
30+ Dead

Chivalric Obligation
Rank 1
✚ Your elevated status requires that you show bravery, strength, and conviction in all your affairs.
Chivalric Obligations require three (3) Virtues, one of which is Courage — braving danger and facing fear or defeat without hesitation.
Select two other Virtues from the list below:
Temperance, Indulgence, Avarice, Charity, Humility, Compassion, Wrath, Deceipt, Justice, Loyalty, Honesty . . .
You gain Dedication which measures your commitment to yoru Chivalric Obligation. When you gain this Talent, your Dedication equals 3.
Whenever you act against your Virtues, reduce your Dedication by -1. If your Dedication is 0 or less, increase the Entropy by +5.

Templar

Avowed Quest
Rank 1
✚ Your are on a Quest of great importance. Write a new Target with the Quest keyword to represent this undertaking. Work with the BAMF to structure this Target. You may only have one Quest of this type active at a time.
Your Quest grants you Conviction, allowing you to access powers to be used in pursuit of your Quest. When you gain this Talent, your Conviction equals 5.
As you set out on a Quest, select one Effect Skill from the list below to be your Boon, and gain +1 Skill Rank in the chosen Skill:
Bellor, Destroy, Inferno, Lux, Mori, Nox, Ordi, Vivus
Each time you gain 1+ Milestones from a part of your Quest, your Conviction increases by +5.
If you fail to complete your Quest, lose 1 Renown and increase the Entropy by +5.
If you have no Quest, your Conviction is 0. You may write a new Target with the Quest keyword at the beginning of the each Waypoint.
Strike (2)

Basic Shifts
Move
To an Adjacent Zone
Within your Current Zone
Defy Danger
Use Your Equipment
Reload / Restring / Unjam a weapon
Draw / Change a weapon
Use a consumable item
Initiate a Contest
You issue a challenge to a single enemy to engage you one on one. If they take up your Challenge, you enter into a Contest.
Create an Advantage
Describe a way to use a Skill quickly to aid in your allies efforts.

Roll up to Challenge to create a number of Advantages in the Current Zone equal to the total Hits in the result set.
Use an Advantage
Bonus Hits: Add +1d4 Bonus Hits to any roll.
Trigger a talent: Automatically use a Trigger Talent.
Ignore a Hazard: Remove 1 Hazard die from your next roll.
Re-roll a 1: Re-roll a single die in a result set that landed on 1.
Calm the chaos: Reduce the current Entropy by 1.
Wait for it. . .
Prepare an Action until a certain condition is met, such as when an enemy enters their current Zone or an ally lights the wagon on fire. The player declares the Action and associated condition, then waits to make the roll to attempt the Action.

Talent Shifts

Assassin

Marked for Death
Rank 2
✚ Use your Tactics to mark your target, giving them Aura X, where X is equal to Hits in your result set. Your target is Vulnerable 1 to any Action you take against it while the Aura persists.

Heretic

Heterodoxy
Rank 3
✚ Use a Shift to maintain your Composure, immediately gaining 1d4+1 Concordance.

Berserker

Rage
Rank 1
✚ Exert yourself, entering a trance-like fury to crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentations of their women. You gain a Rage Aura equal to Hits +1 in the result set.
While you are in a Rage, you may decrease your Rage Aura by -1 to add +2 Bonus Hits to any Action using Exert, Endure, Grapple, Intimidate, Martial Arts, Strike, or Throw.
If your Rage Aura equals 0 or you use a Shift to dismiss it, you gain Fatigued 2 and Confused 1, and the Entropy increases by +1.
If your Rage Aura is 8+, you gain Fatigued 2 and Confused, and the Entropy increases by +2.

Rank 3
✚ Spend X Hits from the result set of the next Marvel you use this turn to increase your Attunement by X.

✚ Use a Shift to protect 1 ally in your Current Zone.

Master Investigator
Rank 3
✚ Use a Shift to Investigate, then Analyze your findings, summing the Hits in both result sets.

Nature's Wrath
Rank 3
✚ Spend X Attunement and spend an Action to use two Marvels. You can add +X bonus Hits to either Marvel's result set.
Your Attunement decreases to 0.

Overseer

Recruit Henchmen
Rank 1
✚ Persuade at Challenge 3 to gain Hits + Savvy Henchmen Ranks to recruit Henchmen from the Henchman Minions table.
Henchmen are a type of Minion you can command to do your bidding.
Each type of Henchman has it own Cost which specifies the number of Henchmen Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Henchmen have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Henchman's Grit reaches 0, they die. You may compose a letter of condolences to their next of kin if you see fit to stoop.
Your Henchmen wait for your instruction. On each of your turns, your Henchmen use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are in a city. If you use it during a Waypoint while you are in a city, it requires 7 + Savvy Actions (minimum 1 Action).
Advanced Henchmen: Each Henchman also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Henchmen have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Henchman's rating by using the Promote Henchman talent.

Necromancer

Stir the Dead
Rank 1
✚ Use Mori to gain Hits + Mori Haunt Ranks to recruit Haunts from the Haunt Minions table.
Haunts are a type of undead Minion you can command to do you bidding.
Each type of Haunt has it own Cost which specifies the number of Haunts Ranks you mus invest to recruit them.
The different Haunts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Haunt's Grit reaches 0, they are released from your service and rejoin the souls you've yet to disturb.
Your Haunts wait for your instruction. On each of your turns, your Haunts use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near the spirits or remain of the dead. If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near the spirits or remain of the dead, it requires 6 - Mori Rank Actions (minimum 1 Action).
Advanced Haunts: Each Haunt also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Haunt have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Haunts's rating by using the Empower Haunts talent.

Tame Beasts
Rank 1
✚ Maintain your Composure at challenge 3 to gain Hits + Steady Beast Ranks to recruit Beasts from the Beast Minions table.
Beasts are a type of Minion you train to follow your commands.
Each type of Beast has it own Cost which specifies the number of Beast Ranks you must invest to recruit them.
The different Beasts have their own statistics that specify their Grit, Actions, and any Talents they have.
If one of your Beasts' Grit reaches 0, they die. You're a terrible person if you let your pets die.
Your Beasts wait for your instruction. On each of your turns, your Beasts use either a Shift or an Action unless you use a Talent to lead them.
You may use this Ability without spending an Action at the beginning of each Waypoint if you are near a fertile wilderness region. If you use it during a Waypoint while you are near a fertile wilderness region, it requires 7 - Steady Actions (minimum 1 Action).
Advanced Beasts: Each Beast also has a Rating that determines how experienced they are. All Beasts have a rating of 1 when recruited. You can increase a Beasts' rating by using the Train Beasts talent.

  • Reduce the Challenge by -1.

  • Increase the Entropy by +2.
  • All enemies in your Current and all Adjacent Zones become Provoked by you.

Aether

Threshold — 2
Your Current Zone gains Hazard 2 Ongoing. It requires 2 Shifts to Move into or out of your Current Zone Ongoing.

Threshold — 2
Select one target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone. This turn, and on each of your turns Ongoing, you may use a Shift for one of the following:

  • The target takes 1d4 Bonus Hits.
  • Increase one of the target's Statuses one Status by +1.
  • Decrease one of the target's Statuses one Status by -1.

Threshold — 1
One target in your Current Zone takes X Hits, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

Threshold — 3
Up to 3 Targets in your Current Zone take X Hits, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

Your Current Zone gains Hazard 2 Ongoing. It requires 2 Shifts to Move into or out of your Current Zone Ongoing.

Threshold — 2
Select one target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone. This turn, and on each of your turns Ongoing, you may use a Shift for one of the following:

  • The target takes 1d4 Bonus Hits.
  • Increase one of the target's Statuses one Status by +1.
  • Decrease one of the target's Statuses one Status by -1.

Threshold — 1
Target one Zone up to 2 Zone Adjacent to your Current Zone. The targetted Zone gains +1 Hazard Ongoing.

Threshold — 1
Target your Current or an Adjacent Zone. This turn, and on each of your turns Ongoing, you may use a Shift for one of the following:

  • Move the Storm one Adjacent Zone.
  • One ally in the Storm's Zone may immediately use the Recover Action
  • One target in the Storm's Zone takes 1d4 Bonus Hits.

Threshold — 3
Up to 3 Targets in your Current Zone take X Hits, where X is equal to Hits in the result set.

  • Decrease one of the target's Statuses one Status by -1.

Aether

Threshold — 1
Send a bolt of cosmic energy at a target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, scoring 1 Hit.

Threshold — 3
Send a bolt of cosmic energy at a target in your Current or an Adjacent Zone, scoring 2 Hits.

Threshold — 4
Send a wave of energy outward, pushing all targets in your Current Zone to the Adjacent Zone closest to them.

Threshold — 2
Open a cosmic tunnel between your Current Zone and a linear Zone up to 2 Zones adjacent Ongoing. While the tunnel persists, characters can Shift to Move between the tunnel's endpoints without incurring Hazard.

Threshold — 4
Open a cosmic tunnel between your Current Zone and a linear Zone up to 2 Zones adjacent. While the tunnel persists, you and your allies can Shift to Move between the tunnel's endpoints without incurring Hazard.

Threshold — 2
The current Timer expires.

Threshold — 4
The current Timer expires. The next Timer is set to 4.

Threshold — 4
When one of your allies you can see suffers Hits from an attack, you momentarily send them to the Aether, reducing the Hits they take by Hits in the result set. Create 1 Advantage in the target ally's Current Zone.

You gain Unconscious 3.
Rank 4
You gain Unconscious 5.
Surgeon's
Rank 2
You become Prone, and gain Restrained 2 and Silent 2.
Rank 3
You become Prone, and gain Restrained 3 and Silent 2.
Rank 4
You become Prone, and gain Restrained 5 and Silent 3.
Potion's
Fox
Rank 1
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you add +1d4 Bonus Hits the the result set of any Action using Analyze, Cosmology, History, Investigate, Nature, Perceive, Research, Skrimisiology, or Theology.
Rank 2
Gain Aura 3. While this Aura persists, you add +1d4 Bonus Hits the the result set of any Action using Analyze, Cosmology, History, Investigate, Nature, Perceive, Research, Skrimisiology, or Theology.
Rank 3
Gain Aura 5. While this Aura persists, you add +1d4 Bonus Hits the the result set of any Action using Analyze, Cosmology, History, Investigate, Nature, Perceive, Research, Skrimisiology, or Theology.
Hare
Rank 1
Gain +4 to your Reflexes Defense and gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you gain an additional Shift on each of your turns. When this Aura ends, you gain Fatigued.
Rank 2
Gain +4 to your Reflexes Defense and gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you gain an additional Shift on each of your turns. When this Aura ends, you gain Fatigued.
Rank 3
Gain +4 to your Reflexes Defense and gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you gain an additional Shift on each of your turns. If you do not use a Shift on your turn, you gain 1 additional Aciton. When this Aura ends, you gain Fatigued.
Hawk
Rank 2
Gain Aura 3. While this Aura persists, you gain the Flying keyword.
Rank 3
Gain Aura 3. While this Aura persists, you gain the Flying keyword.
Rank 4
Gain Aura 4. While this Aura persists, you gain the Flying keyword.

Rank 2

Rank 4
Gain Aura 5. While this Aura persists, you gain the Aquatic keyword.

Rank 2
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you cannot gain the Fatigued Status and are immune to the effects of Poisons.

Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, you cannot gain the Fatigued Status and are immune to the effects of Poisons.
Rank 4

Titan
Rank 1
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, +1 Bonus Hits to Exert, Grapple, Martial Arts, Strike, or Throw.
Rank 2
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, +1 Bonus Hits to Exert, Grapple, Martial Arts, Strike, or Throw.
Rank 3
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, +1d4 Bonus Hits to Exert, Grapple, Martial Arts, Strike, or Throw.
Tortoise
Rank 3
Gain Aura 1. While this Aura persists, prevent all Hits to your Defenses and Grit.
Rank 4
Gain Aura 2. While this Aura persists, prevent all Hits to your Defenses and Grit.
Rank 5
Gain Aura 3. While this Aura persists, prevent all Hits to your Defenses and Grit.
Minions
Minion 1—

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move, it gains Hidden 3.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion attacks a target while Hidden, add +2 bonus the the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion scores Hits against one target in its Current Zone and the target takes 5+ Hits this turn, the target gains Vulnerable 2.

Beast

Trigger — When you use the Recover Action, this minion regains +2 Grit.

Beast

Trigger — When you attempt to Perceive your surroundings, you may choose to Perceive your Current Zone or this Minion's Current Zone. If you and this Minion are in the same Current Zone, add +2 Bnous Hits to the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When you or an ally attempts to use Survival skills to track a target while in this Minion's Current Zone, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion does not use a Shift to Move on your turn, it may score X Hits against one target in its Current Zone, where X is equal to its Melle Rating.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move to an Adjacent Zone and attack a target, it may ignores Hazards and its target becomes Prone.

Beast

Trigger — When your or your allies are the target of an Ambush while in this Minion's Current Zone, you may add +1d4 bonus hits to the Initiative Test.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move within its Current or into an Adjacent Zone, X targets in its Current Zone gain Provoked, where X is equal to this Minion's Current Grit.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minon would score Hits against a target in its Current Zone, the target gains Fatigued 1.

Undead

Trigger — When this Minon would score Hits against a target in its Current Zone, the target gains Fatigued 1.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you suffer Hits from a target you can see and this Minion is in your Current Zone, you may redirect the Hits to this Minion.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in this Minion's Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger —

Henchmen

Trigger — When a target uses a Shift to Move past this Minion, the target adds an additional +1 Hazard to their team's next roll.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you or your allies use Cosmology, History, Researhc, Skrimisiology, or Theology and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you or your allies use the Recover Aciton and this Minion is in your Current Zone, you regain +1 Grit.
Trigger — When you or your allies use Medicine and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in a Zone Adjacent to this Minion's Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When this Minon uses a Shifts to Move, you may have it gain Hidden 2.
Trigger — When you or your allies use your Implements and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in this Minion's Current Zone and the target dies, you may have this Minion deal X hits to another target in its Current Zone, where X is equal to this Minions Melee rating.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in this Minion's Current Zone and the target dies, you may have this Minion gain an additional Shift this turn.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you send this Minion to manage diplomacy in your stead, you may roll Lead instead of Deceive or Persaude to conduct the deliberations.

Henchmen

Trigger — When this Minon uses a Shifts to Move, you may have it gain Hidden 2.
Trigger — When you or your allies Perceive and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in a Zone Adjacent to this Minion's Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When this Minon uses a Shifts to Move, you may have it gain Hidden 2.
Trigger — When you or your allies use your Implements and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in this Minion's Current Zone and the target dies, you may have this Minion deal X hits to another target in its Current Zone, where X is equal to this Minions Melee rating.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you Lead your Minions to score Hits against a target in this Minion's Current Zone and the target dies, you may have this Minion gain an additional Shift this turn.

Henchmen

Trigger — When you send this Minion to manage diplomacy in your stead, you may roll Lead instead of Deceive or Persaude to conduct the deliberations.

Henchmen

Trigger — When this Minon uses a Shifts to Move, you may have it gain Hidden 2.
Trigger — When you or your allies Perceive and this Minion is in your Current Zone, add +2 Bonus Hits to the result set.
Minion 8—

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move, it gains Hidden 3.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion attacks a target while Hidden, add +2 bonus the the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion scores Hits against one target in its Current Zone and the target takes 5+ Hits this turn, the target gains Vulnerable 2.

Beast

Trigger — When you use the Recover Action, this minion regains +2 Grit.

Beast

Trigger — When you attempt to Perceive your surroundings, you may choose to Perceive your Current Zone or this Minion's Current Zone. If you and this Minion are in the same Current Zone, add +2 Bnous Hits to the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When you or an ally attempts to use Survival skills to track a target while in this Minion's Current Zone, add +1d4 Bonus Hits to the result set.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion does not use a Shift to Move on your turn, it may score X Hits against one target in its Current Zone, where X is equal to its Melle Rating.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move to an Adjacent Zone and attack a target, it may ignores Hazards and its target becomes Prone.

Beast

Trigger — When your or your allies are the target of an Ambush while in this Minion's Current Zone, you may add +1d4 bonus hits to the Initiative Test.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minion Shifts to Move within its Current or into an Adjacent Zone, X targets in its Current Zone gain Provoked, where X is equal to this Minion's Current Grit.

Beast

Trigger — When this Minon would score Hits against a target in its Current Zone, the target gains Fatigued 1.
